What It Does: Navigates to the menu/help card with game settings and instructions
How Does It Work: Saves current card index, sets isOnStartingCard flag, adds 'showing-menu' CSS class to flashcard and body, updates title text, calls renderMenuCard() to populate menu HTML, unflips card if flipped, optionally flips to back (help side) after 100ms delay

What It Does: Returns from menu card to the previously viewed game card
How Does It Work: Checks if on starting card, sets isOnStartingCard to false, removes 'showing-menu' CSS classes, restores currentIndex from savedIndex, updates wordpack title display, calls updateDisplay() to render game card

What It Does: Creates the HTML for the menu card with dropdowns for act, wordpack, language, speed, and voice selection
How Does It Work: Builds HTML template string with two divs (front = menu, back = help), uses language-aware labels (detects Chinese for pinyin-specific instructions), injects HTML into spanishWord and englishWord elements, then uses setTimeout to populate dropdowns after DOM render, attaches event listeners to all selectors and buttons for state changes

What It Does: Switches between learning modes (flashcard, spelling, pronunciation, translation) and resets deck state
How Does It Work: Checks if already in mode (early return), cancels any active speech, sets currentMode variable, updates active button CSS classes, resets deck to originalDeck copy (preserves baseâ†’example order), resets flip state, clears pendingDeckChange counter, initializes typing display if spelling/translation mode, calls updateDisplay(), auto-pronounces word if spelling mode after 300ms delay, updates debug UI, saves state

What It Does: Deprecated compatibility function that does nothing (voice selector now populated in renderMenuCard)
How Does It Work: Empty function body with comment - kept for backwards compatibility but does nothing

What It Does: Populates tooltip content for mode buttons and control bar buttons using TOOLTIP_MESSAGES
How Does It Work: Builds HTML strings from TOOLTIP_MESSAGES constant for each mode tooltip area (reading, listening, speaking, writing), injects them into tooltip divs, then calls window.createButtonTooltip() from wordpack-logic.js for each control button, passing the button element and corresponding message HTML

What It Does: Main initialization function that loads saved state, sets up the game, populates UI elements, and starts the app
How Does It Work: Loads state with loadState(), validates it, loads module acts for detected language, populates act selector, attaches event listeners to act dropdown (loads new act on change), populates wordpack dropdown for current act, populates native language dropdown, populates voice dropdown, sets up speed buttons with active state, initializes tooltips, calls updateChineseModeClass() to apply CSS, if valid wordpack exists calls initializeDeck() to create cards, otherwise auto-selects first act/pack

What It Does: Deprecated function that did nothing (card labels have been removed)
How Does It Work: Empty function body with comment - kept for backwards compatibility but does nothing

What It Does: Generates CSS gradients for random sun-faded weathering effects on flashcards using seed-based randomization
How Does It Work: Uses card ID as seed with Math.sin() for deterministic pseudo-random values, generates 4 edge fade percentages (15-25%), 3 RGB tint values (brownish sepia), edge intensity (0.18-0.30), overall intensity (0.03-0.07), 3 random splotch positions (20-80%), creates 7 CSS gradient strings (3 radial ellipses for splotches + 4 linear gradients for edges), joins them with commas and returns as single CSS background-image value

What It Does: Main display function that renders the current card content based on mode (flashcard, spelling, pronunciation, translation)
How Does It Work: Early return if on starting card, checks if deck empty (shows completion screen), gets current card object from currentDeck[currentIndex], sets counter text (different format for flashcard vs other modes), branches on currentMode: flashcard=shows target word front + translation back using render functions, spelling=shows typing display with wrong letters/count indicators front + target word+translation back, translation=shows translation+typing display front + target word back, pronunciation=shows target word front + translation back with mic UI, all modes use renderTargetWordHTML() and renderTranslationHTML() from wordpack-logic.js which handle Chinese coupling automatically

What It Does: Removes the 'flipped' CSS class to show the front of the flashcard
How Does It Work: Removes 'flipped' class from flashcard element, sets isFlipped flag to false, does NOT stop speech (lets it continue)

What It Does: Shows pronunciation feedback with score, what was heard vs expected, and handles penalties for low scores
How Does It Work: Gets feedback elements based on isFront parameter, calculates dynamic threshold using getSimilarityThreshold(), checks if pronunciation mode: if yes and score >= threshold removes card with success stamp, if score < threshold adds 2 duplicate penalty cards and advances after 1600ms, if not pronunciation mode shows feedback overlay with score percentage, color-coded CSS class from getScoreClass(), message from getFeedbackMessage(), and heard text

What It Does: Initializes the game with a selected wordpack, creates deck, and starts playing
How Does It Work: Checks if wordpack exists, calls initializeDeck() with selected wordpack key to create card objects, sets gameStarted flag, exits starting card view, resets current index to 0, calls updateDisplay() to show first card, saves state to localStorage
